activities.loc: Br 9 - Law Enforcement Center - Lower Level

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ruben Leal

records.addlTxt: Racine County Alternatives Program

9:24 AM Defendant Ruben Leal in court.  Attorney Grant Ian Henderson in court for Ruben Leal.  Prosecuting attorney Dirk Christian Jensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski. 
Defense requests another status.
Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on November 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Racine County Alternatives Program
by DA to Defense to Obtain Copies of Certain Evidence.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim L.V.R and child  (person, property, residence or family). It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

AMENDED 9/1/22 to no violent contact with L.V.R. (person, property, residence or family)
NG plea entered.

10:16 AM Defendant Ruben Leal in court, in custody.  Attorney Grant Ian Henderson in court for Ruben Leal.  Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Parties are prepared to proceed today. 
State class Investigator Diener, DSAT. Cross by Defense. 
State moves for bind over. 
Defense objects to bind over and makes statement as to why. 
State responds. 
BTC: Court finds probable cause, case bound over to trial judge. 
Defense requests to be heard on bond today and requests bond to be modified to $500 cash. 
State indicates the victim is present in court and wants to address the court. 
Victim gives statement and requests bond be lowered. 
State doesn't object to reduction in amount of bond. 
Defense gives response. 
BTC: BOND MODIFICATION: Granted bond to be modified to $1500 cash.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:19 AM Defendant Ruben Leal in court, in custody.  Attorney Grant Ian Henderson in court for Ruben Leal.  Prosecuting attorney Patricia J Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
BTC: Set for preliminary hearing.
Defense requests to be heard on bond.
Victims not notified.
BTC: Bond to be heard at next hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
From deft re: bond reduction

Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim L.V.R and child  (person, property, residence or family). It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

1:56 PM Prosecuting attorney Patricia J Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ruben Leal appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth Martha Angove appeared by video for Ruben Leal. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
